item.title: Marketing Director
item.dc:creator: ace-cham
item.content:encoded:
This is a fantastic opportunity for a highly motivated Front-End Developer to join an outstanding team based in Bolton - Lancashire. An exciting and fast-growing internet business, who are one of the UKs leading comparison websites. They offer employees a great working environment with vast opportunities for progression and development. As the company continues to successfully strive forwards and grow within the ever expanding industry, this is an exceptional chance for a like minded person to join a market-leading business that is well placed to continue on its current trajectory. They are now searching for a passionate individual who can produce stunning user faces through a solid understanding of HTML and CSS along with experience of implementing A/B tests with the use of JavaScript. To be considered for the role you must match the following criteria:
  • 3-5 years recent experience of front end development
  • Great knowledge of HTML and CSS
  • Strong communication skills and experience of working within development and creative teams
  • Experience of A/B testing
  • Understanding of JavaScript
You will be responsible for:
  • Using HTML / CSS to develop visually stunning. User-driven websites
  • Taking a website from initial layout to a fully responsive, functioning, live site
  • Collaborating with fellow developers, creatives and user experience professionals to deliver development projects
  • Maintaining working knowledge of content management and eCommerce solutions
  • Maintaining beautiful and well-documented code
  • Using JavaScripts to run A/B tests.

item.title: Accounting Technical Support
item.dc:creator: employers
item.content:encoded:
This is a fantastic opportunity for a highly motivated Accounting Technical Support assistant to join an outstanding team based in Manchester. An exciting and fast-growing accounting firm, who are one of the UKs largest accounting businesses. They offer employees a great working environment with vast opportunities for progression and development. As the company continues to successfully strive forwards and grow within the ever expanding industry, this is an exceptional chance for a like minded person to join a market-leading business that is well placed to continue on its current trajectory. To be considered for the role you must match the following criteria:
  • 3-5 years recent experience of accounting
  • Excellent IT skills, including a good working knowledge of MS Windows and MS Office
  • Have great customer service
  • Experience in accounting software packages
  • Accounting knowledge and experience (to AAT level or equivalent).
You will be responsible for:
  • Ensuring all statements are recorded and filed properly
  • Giving a high level of technical assistance to customers
  • Preparation of basic tax computations and tax returns

item.title: Motor Transport Technician
item.dc:creator: employers
item.content:encoded:
Motor Repairs Co. are looking for an experienced Motor Technician to join their team on a temporary to permanent basis. To be considered for the role you must match the following criteria:
  • Attend breakdowns within performance response times and procedures
  • Prepare all vehicle type for MOT in accordance with current legislations and procedures
  • To communicate effectively with a wide range of team members, managers and customers
  • Experience in accounting software packages
  • Accounting knowledge and experience (to AAT level or equivalent).
You will be responsible for:
  • Strong communication skills
  • Excellent team player
  • Qualified in Motor Mechanics to NVQ level 3 or equivalent
  • HGV licence
  • Forklift truck competence
All applicants will be treated in the strictest of confidence.

item.title: Finance Manager
item.dc:creator: employers
item.content:encoded:
Finance Network Ltd is a rapidly expanding business with ambitious growth plans over the next five years. In order for us to realise these plans we need a strong competent finance team who not only can ensure the financials are correct but also provide evidence based direction in supporting the achievement of our growth plans. We require an ambitious qualified Accountant who, after building on their experience following qualification, is looking to take their career to the next stage. As the company continues to successfully strive forwards and grow within the ever expanding industry, this is an exceptional chance for a like minded person to join a market-leading business that is well placed to continue on its current trajectory. Your Background You will be a fully qualified Accountant (ACA, ACCA or CIMA), ideally practice trained with strong financial/statutory accounting experience. You will be fully up to date with all accounting legislation including UKGAAP. You will possess superb Excel skills, your peers should see you as a strong financial modeller who is not only able to fully manipulate data but also present it to non-financial stakeholders with ease. You will be responsible for:
  • Ensuring all statements are recorded and filed properly
  • Giving a high level of technical assistance to customers
  • Preparation of basic tax computations and tax returns

item.title: Web Analyst
item.dc:creator: employers
item.content:encoded:
This is a fantastic opportunity for a highly motivated Accounting Technical Support assistant to join an outstanding team based in Manchester. An exciting and fast-growing accounting firm, who are one of the UKs largest accounting businesses. They offer employees a great working environment with vast opportunities for progression and development. The Web Analyst will report to the Web Operations Manager and will provide support to key stakeholders in the ecommerce team and the wider marketing and product development functions. The successful candidate will be responsible for providing actionable insight of the web performance both for the UK and internationally, providing a holistic view of the performance of all our key activities and promotions.
Skills and Experience Required:
  • Excellent analytical skills
  • Knowledge and use of SQL would be preferable however is not essential.
  • A curious mind and an eye for detail with accurate grammar and spelling is essential for success in this role.
  • Ability to translate complex data into business reports and presentations which can be used by the wider team and wider business stakeholders
  • Excellent communication / interpersonal skills both written and verbal
Duties and Responsibilities:
  • Analysing consumer behaviour, conversion data, customer journeys and basket funnel analysis
  • Provide actionable insight to the product teams to help aid the NPD process and lifecycle management
  • Create meaningful weekly web trading report for the ecommerce team, provide timely product sales reports for the product teams and sales forecasting for the operational teams
  • Delivering regular reporting, analysis of the web performance and from this determine actions required to drive the business and sales forward

item.title: Geography Teacher - Secondary School
item.dc:creator: employers
item.content:encoded:
Your role will consist of becoming a key member of the Geography department, setting work and supporting pupils through their learning. You will take 80% timetable, to give plenty of PPA time, where a supportive team will guide you through your NQT year. NQT (Newly Qualified Teacher) The school requires a passionate NQT, who is keen to embark on their career as a Geography teacher. You will have got a solid undergraduate degree in a Geography related subject, and completed your teacher training with QTS, and 'outstanding' or 'good' grades in your placements. Skills and Experience Required:
  • Excellent Geography skills
  • Knowledge and experience in using a compass
  • Confident knowledge in lakes and rivers
  • Ability to lead a group of students on trips out in the hills
  • Excellent communication / interpersonal skills both written and verbal

item.title: Regional Finance Manager
item.dc:creator: employers
item.content:encoded:
Our client is seeking a Regional Finance Manager to become the finance lead for the West Midlands(Birmingham, Dudley and Coventry). They are the UKs largest leisure provider with arts and events centres as well and have been expanding year-on-year since their inception over 20 years ago. This growth means that they require a finance lead to support the Regional Director and take a lead for financial systems and other related areas i.e. insurances, legal and governance in the region. You will be required to be fully qualified, or qualified by experience, and be able to ensure financial processes are followed for sales ledger, debtor control and income reconciliation. You will liaise with the regional finance team in the day to day running of the sales ledger and income reconciliation. You will produce monthly management accounts, reconcile balance sheet accounts and coordinate the production of the regions budgets. You will oversee a management accountant at each of the regional offices. Skills and Experience Required:
  • Excellent analytical skills
  • Knowledge and use of SQL would be preferable however is not essential.
  • A curious mind and an eye for detail with accurate grammar and spelling is essential for success in this role.
  • Ability to translate complex data into business reports and presentations which can be used by the wider team and wider business stakeholders
  • Excellent communication / interpersonal skills both written and verbal
    Some travel is required across the region and to the London office (likely to be monthly or less)
Experience gained within a multi site finance operation is preferable.

item.title: Structural Design Engineer
item.dc:creator: employers
item.content:encoded:
This is a fantastic opportunity for a highly motivated Accounting Technical Support assistant to join an outstanding team based in Manchester. An exciting and fast-growing accounting firm, who are one of the UKs largest accounting businesses. They offer employees a great working environment with vast opportunities for progression and development. As Brand and Design Manager, you will be a creative genius, responsible for overseeing our corporate brand, tactical local marketing initiatives and our various brand franchises. Fusion has over 90 dynamic venues offering mainstream & specialist sports and leisure plus some exciting new brands such as INTENCITY (HIIT fitness studio concept), Total Football (5 a side league venue), Bickel's Yard (proprietary caf? concept), and has a pipeline of innovation development
Candidate Description:
  • Structural Engineer with min 5 years experience
  • Experience designing temporary works would be a benefit
  • Experience designing steel connections would be a benefit
  • Must have experience designing with all material types
  • Must be capable of using AutoCAD
Responsibilities:
  • Liaise with site teams to develop construction sequences and identify where temporary structures will be required
  • Design of temporary structures, including production of report
  • Production of drawings showing construction sequences and temporary structure details
  • Design of steel connections
  • Liaison with steel fabricators to oversee fabrication drawing production
  • Liaison with site engineers to produce surveys in order to produce steel fabrication drawings
  • Assist commercial team in pricing tenders where technical input is required
  • Rationalise client engineer designs and negotiate changes with client engineer
  • Attend design meetings

item.title: Home Appliance Engineer
item.dc:creator: employers
item.content:encoded:
The Home Appliance Engineer will be responsible for the service and repair of white goods equipment in domestic properties within your local area. Responding to calls in a timely and efficient manner to maintain their high first time fix rates and happy customer base. As a Home Appliance Engineer, you are required to have previous or existing experience with the Domestic Appliance industry, and to have very good people skills. This position also offers a motivating working environment where you can use your skills to help transform a company and to shape the industry. The Home Appliance Engineer salary is dependent on experience, qualifications and location. However with OTE’s the Home Appliance Engineer would earn up to £35K. The Home Appliance Engineer can also expect to receive a pleasing benefits package including a fully stocked and equipped van, phone, 4 weeks holiday, discounts, pension schemes and much more. As well there are great career prospects within this company too. Requirements:
  • Experience of servicing, diagnosing and fixing white goods equipment.
  • Good Technical Knowledge.
  • ACS Qualified (Desirable but not essential)
  • Clean Driving Licence (no more than 6 points)
  • Clean DBS

item.title: Legal Cashier
item.dc:creator: employers
item.content:encoded:
You will be responsible for supporting the operation of the firms' accounting system and PAYE scheme, ensure that all cheques are written on correct amounts and the Client Account is never overdrawn, ensure that all banking is done directly, enter postings to the accounts system on daily basis and all matters are recorded correctly, assist in the entering of bills and Telegraphic Transfers, deal with invoices in a timely manner, directly deal with candidates when receiving payment by cheque or cash, manage the petty cash procedure, manage your own work allocation with minimum supervision, support the operation of credit control, ensure all closed accounts are authorised and that nil balances are achieved before archiving and making good decisions when dealing with problems. You must have good working knowledge of the Solicitors Accounts Rules, be highly organised, with excellent attention to detail and the willingness to learn new skills. This would suit candidates who have the ability to support their fellow colleagues within an Accounts Department in the provision of Financial Services by providing competent and efficient assistance. Requirements:
  • Experience of servicing, diagnosing and fixing white goods equipment.
  • Good Technical Knowledge.
  • ACS Qualified (Desirable but not essential)
  • Clean Driving Licence (no more than 6 points)
  • Clean DBS

item.title: Technical Aircraft Engineer
item.dc:creator: employers
item.content:encoded:
Fly Up Aviation has carved its own place in the recruitment of Aviation and Aerospace personnel all over the world for more than 25 years. We work with some of the industry’s best known companies who demand the highest standard of applicants. Responsibilities:
  • Review and evaluate Airworthiness Directives and Service Bulletins.
  • Coordinate scheduled maintenance, the application of Airworthiness Directives, the replacement of service life limited parts, and component inspection to ensure the work is carried out properly.
  • Prepare current status of Engine / Airframe / Component Life Limitations in accordance with the approved maintenance data.
  • Prepare the current status of Engine / Airframe Service Bulletins / Airworthiness Directives as required by the approved maintenance schedule.
  • Ensure that Maintenance Instructions are amended correctly and to the latest issue.
  • Update of appropriate computerised maintenance systems.
Requirements:
  • The ideal candidate will have an Airline/MRO background with at least 5 years relevant experience.
  • This position is based in Skegness but the candidate must be willing and flexible to travel up to 60% of the year worldwide.
The following courses/licenses are essential:
  • ATA 104 Level 1 / Part 66 Cat C course on at least one of the following aircraft types is essential.
  • B737 300/400/500
  • B737 600/700/800/900
  • A318/319/320/321

item.title: Digital Designer
item.dc:creator: employers
item.content:encoded:
Digital Designer A fantastic opportunity awaits a Digital Designer with commercial experience of InDesign, Photoshop & Illustrator to work for this well-known and respected UK Company based in Hemel Hempstead, Hertfordshire. As a Digital Designer you will be responsible for juggling a selection of projects, both large and small across digital and print formats. This role will require a Digital Designer who can contribute to the continued growth and development of the Digital team's offerings by offering fresh ideas and creative input within the established branding, look and feel. The successful Digital Designer is likely to already be a Digital Designer having used InDesign, Photoshop & Illustrator with excellent communication skills, great attention to detail and the ability to work to strict timescales. Skills & experience required for the Digital Designer include:
  • Experience of using InDesign.
  • Knowledge of Photoshop & Illustrator.
  • UX/UI responsive design experience across desktop, tablet and mobile.
  • The ability to confidently consider factors such as usability across different devices, accessibility and colour theory.
  • Some HTML/CSS/JavaScript experience would be advantageous.
  • Any exposure to app design/development would be advantageous.
  • Excellent design experience.
This is a brand new role which will complement my clients existing print team but further reinforce their capabilities within digital design.

item.title: Bar Team Member
item.dc:creator: employers
item.content:encoded:
Are you awesome? We have awesome drinks that need serving to our awesome guests. We have Cocktails in cans to Peppermint Tea, Healthy smoothies to craft beer, cask ales to crazy concoctions coupled together with great food, a cool place to hangout, all topped off to the soundtrack selected by your guests via the Secret DJ!? Now if this doesn't tick all the boxes of being a Bar Team Member - I don't know what will. If going the extra mile for someone comes naturally to you, you could be a natural fit with us! It is strengths like these that we look for in our people. You are comfortable starting a conversation with anyone, answering their questions or meeting their requests, doing that bit extra for them and going the extra mile. It comes naturally to you. For you, making people smile is what makes it all worthwhile. Seeing our customers happy is what makes you happy. When you have made sure everyone has had the best possible time and leaves us with a smile you feel like you have had a great day. You do not necessarily need any experience but you do need to be able to demonstrate that you are a great team player as well as being able to work unsupervised during busy times and keen to learn. In return, we can offer you an award winning development programme with access to apprenticeships along with 25% discount on food and drink for you and your entire party in all our pubs and venues. We have an employee benefits scheme which gives you discounts across hundreds of brands and services and a contributory pension scheme. Requirements:
  • Flexible working hours.
  • Ability to work in loud environment.
  • Ability to mix liquids to create delicious drinks.

item.title: Sport and Outdoor Education Teacher
item.dc:creator: employers
item.content:encoded:
Our client provides a range of social care, special education, community support and consultancy services in the North West of England. The charity is one of the North West’s largest providers of residential homes for children from short-term emergency care to long-term placements. Their fostering service provides family placements in the North West and neighbouring regions.
Joining a team of Teachers and Support Workers, the Sport and Outdoor Education Teacher will teach a range of courses (including BTEC) and programmes at their KS4 College, as well as being involved in new and exciting curriculum planning and development.
They are looking for an individual who holds a nationally recognised teaching qualification such as QTS / QTLS or equivalent and who has sound knowledge of, and practical skills in, sports and outdoor education related subjects appropriate to the age of the pupils. With excellent literacy and numeracy skills, you will be capable of planning and preparing coherent teaching programmes and lessons which ensure continuity and progression for the children’s learning whilst maintaining discipline and promotion of positive behaviour in the classroom.
With the ability to motivate and sustain the interest of all the children, you will have clear and concise communication skills and use questions designed to stimulate thinking and illicit responses from pupils of all abilities. With an understanding of the principles of different kinds of pupil assessment against national standards, you will monitor, assess and record and report on aptitudes, needs and progress of individual pupils, providing constructive feedback where required.

item.title: Marketing Analyst
item.dc:creator: employers
item.content:encoded:
Immediate Start Our client is a well-known institution who require a Marketing Analyst to join them as soon as possible. As an organisation they need the eligible Marketing Analyst who has a thorough understand across a range of analytics tools. Responsibilities:
  • Work across wider marketing team to provide training on how to use Google Analytics ( plus other tools), how to setup, monitor and report of digital campaigns.
  • Review campaigns, performance, statics.
  • Work with media buyers, provide insight and recommendations.
  • Work with external agencies.
  • Work with web and digital team to understand how to achieve maximum performance from website.
  • Set up PPC campaigns, train others.
Requirements:
  • Excellent Excel skills.
  • Knowledge of broad digital marketing.
  • A degree.
The Digital Recruitment Firm is acting as an employment agency with this Marketing Analyst role. If your feel you have the right Marketing Analyst skills and would like to be considered for this role. Please send us your CV for immediate consideration.

item.title: Paint Sprayer
item.dc:creator: employers
item.content:encoded:
Paint Sprayer Paint Sprayers required for ongoing contract in Leighton Buzzard, Bedfordshire paying up to £13.50 per hour working on both Days and Nights. The Paint Sprayer will be working in a busy refurbishment/fleet environment and will suit Paint Sprayers who are used to working in a fast paced automotive workshop. The Paint Sprayer will need to have a current driving license Responsibilities:
  • Paint Sprayers.
  • Automotive.
  • Bodyshop.
  • Refurbishment.

item.title: Graduate Sales Assistant
item.dc:creator: employers
item.content:encoded:
Based in Norwich our client is an established and highly successful technology solutions provider working primarily in the financial markets. The company employs nearly 1000 people in over 30 locations world wide, with operation centers Leeds, London, New York and Singapore. The company is partnered with giants in the technology industry, including some household names and extremely high profile organisations, making this company an enviable one to work for. Requirements:
  • Educated to degree level or equivalent in any discipline
  • Drive and ambition with the desire to succeed
  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills
  • Entrepreneurial and fresh thinking
  • Self-motivated and proactive with a great work ethic
  • Personable and presentable
  • Competitive, someone who constantly strives for the best
  • Confident and ambitious

item.title: Renewable Energy Graduate
item.dc:creator: employers
item.content:encoded:
Renewable Energy Graduate required for our client a specialist provider of renewable energy products based in North Wales. They specialise in providing Biomass, Heat Pumps and Solar PV systems to both the commercial and domestic sectors. The renewable energy graduate will be expected to assist with providing quotations and estimates for new projects, as well as produce designs of Biomass, Heat Pumps and Solar PV installations. The graduate should have a strong knowledge of Sketchup and ideally be able to perform Heat Loss calculations. This position would suit a candidate who is self-motivated and is willing to learn and develop their skills. Renewable Energy Graduate Position Overview Renewable Energy Graduate required for our client a specialist provider of renewable energy products based in North Wales. Requirements:
  • Strong Knowledge of Sketchup design software.
  • Able to perform heat loss calculations.
Benefits:
  • £17,000 to £19,000
  • 20 Days + Bank Holidays
  • 40 hour Working week

item.title: Town Centre Engineer / Council Engineer
item.dc:creator: employers
item.content:encoded:
Our Client is currently recruiting for a Town Centre Engineer to maintain and develop the public realm in Cambridge town centre and to design and undertake environmental improvements across the Borough. It is an exciting opportunity to play a key part in the ongoing redevelopment of the town centre and maintenance of high quality public areas for the benefit of residents, business and visitors to Cambridge.
Their new Engineer will be leading a small team to improve the quality of the local environment and the public realm, through management/maintenance of the highway infrastructure and implementing individual projects around Cambridge Town Centre.
Their ideal candidate will have experience in implementing civil highways and traffic management construction schemes and also in consultation and events. In addition you will be confident managing both projects and people and representing the Council at public meetings.
The Council offers in return a generous flexi time scheme with the ability to take 2 flexi days a month, membership of the local government pension scheme, discounted health and leisure membership, plus many more excellent benefits.

item.title: Care Assistant / Support Worker
item.dc:creator: employers
item.content:encoded:
We specialise in partnering with Continuing Healthcare teams (CHC) to organise and coordinate packages of NHS funded care to the most vulnerable and socially excluded people within our communities. This Care Assistant / Support Worker position is to support a gentleman who has a brain injury located in Ongar. To be considered for this position experience within healthcare is required and experience supporting clients that have a brain injury is an advantage. Care Assistant / Support Worker - Role and Responsibilities:
  • Tracheostomy care
  • Personal care
Benefits:
  • Paid induction
  • Free uniform
  • Ongoing training and support including 2 days complex care training
  • Career progression within a specialist complex care company

item.title: Health Care Assistant
item.dc:creator: employers
item.content:encoded:
A home care agency is looking for enthusiastic, reliable Health Care Assistants to join a thriving business providing a high-quality and much-needed service to vulnerable people throughout the Bromley area. You will receive a 2-3% monthly "consistency" bonus (sticking to agreed availability / roster), tax-free mileage allowance of £0.40 / mile that is paid by us, holiday pay, a company pension scheme, private healthcare plus unbeatable pay. Comprehensive and on-going training and support will be given during the recruitment process. As the Health Care Assistant your duties will include::
  • Personal care and hygiene
  • Food prep, medication, shopping, housework and social support
To be a successful Health Care Assistant you will have the following skills and experience:
  • Full UK driving licence, with access to your own vehicle with MOT and insurance.
  • Previous care experience is preferable but is not essential- any experience would be amazing from previous caring for family.
  • Level 2 health and social care.
  • Flexibility and availability to work the company hours.
  • 100% committed to helping improve the quality of life of vulnerable peopl.
  • An enhanced CRB background check - costing £52.
  • An update DBS will be taken as long it is in date and can be checked by the Care manager.
  • Able to communicate clearly in English with someone who may be confused or hard of hearing.
  • Valid to work in the UK.
The vacant working hours available for this role will be:
  • Weekday mornings - 7am-11am
  • Evenings - 5pm-10pm
  • Weekends - (ALL hours)
There are also opportunities for night shifts and 24-hour Live-in care according to your availability. In return, the Health Care Assistant will receive an hourly pay rate of £8.05 - £10.50 per hour DOE, which increases after probation and with duration of employment.

item.title: Science Teacher
item.dc:creator: fasttrak
item.content:encoded:
Science Teacher – open to current PGCE students looking for NQT placement year - Manchester Would you like to join a high performing, oversubscribed school as their Science Teacher in September 2017? Could you see yourself working in a team with a subject leader who is outstanding with a reputation As the company continues to successfully strive forwards and grow within the ever expanding industry, this is an exceptional chance for a like minded person to join a market-leading business that is well placed to continue on its current trajectory. They are now searching for a passionate individual who can produce stunning user faces through a solid understanding of HTML and CSS along with experience of implementing A/B tests with the use of JavaScript. Skills:
  • 3-5 years recent experience of front end development
  • Great knowledge of HTML and CSS
  • Strong communication skills and experience of working within development and creative teams
  • Experience of A/B testing
  • Understanding of JavaScript
Responsibilities:
  • Using HTML / CSS to develop visually stunning. User-driven websites.
  • Taking a website from initial layout to a fully responsive, functioning, live site
  • Collaborating with fellow developers, creatives and user experience professionals to deliver development projects
  • Maintaining working knowledge of content management and eCommerce solutions
  • Maintaining beautiful and well-documented code
  • Using JavaScripts to run A/B tests.

item.content:encoded: [vc_row][vc_column][rev_slider_vc alias="landing-slider"][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row][vc_column][vc_empty_space height="105px"][vc_custom_heading text="Check Out These <cite>Awesome</cite> Features" font_container="tag:h2|font_size:43px|text_align:center|line_height:68px" use_theme_fonts="yes" custom_font_weight="fw-700" letter_spacing="0.05em" link="url:%23|||"][vc_empty_space height="60px"][vc_row_inner][vc_column_inner width="1/2"][vc_custom_heading text="Easily Create your own Recruitment Website" font_container="tag:h3|font_size:18px|text_align:left|line_height:26px" use_theme_fonts="yes" custom_font_weight="fw-700" letter_spacing="0.05em" link="url:%23|||" el_class="color-primary"][vc_column_text]With Recruitment Agency theme, you can easily set up your own recruitment agency website with no coding required! We’ve done the work for you. [/vc_column_text][vc_empty_space height="40px"][/vc_column_inner][vc_column_inner width="1/2"][vc_custom_heading text="Apply For Multiple Jobs With One Click!" font_container="tag:h3|font_size:18px|text_align:left|line_height:26px" use_theme_fonts="yes" custom_font_weight="fw-700" letter_spacing="0.05em" link="url:%23|||" el_class="color-primary"][vc_column_text]A unique feature in Recruitment Agency theme is the one-click application of jobs in the basket. Admins add jobs via the back-end in WordPress and Employers add them via the front-end section in the Employers profile dashboard." font_container="tag:p|font_size:16px|text_align:center|line_height:32px" use_theme_fonts="yes"][/vc_column_inner][vc_column_inner width="1/6"][/vc_column_inner][/vc_row_inner][vc_empty_space height="130px"][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row][vc_column width="1/2" css=".vc_custom_1489979116727{padding-top: 0px !important;}"][vc_custom_heading text="Admin add new job" font_container="tag:h3|font_size:18px|text_align:center|line_height:26px" use_theme_fonts="yes" custom_font_weight="fw-700" letter_spacing="0.05em" el_class="text-upper" css=".vc_custom_1489979458935{margin-bottom: 20px !important;}"][vc_single_image image="989" img_size="full" alignment="center" css_animation="fadeInLeft" css=".vc_custom_1489979682831{margin-bottom: 22px !important;}"][vc_custom_heading text="Admins do not require credits to post jobs, these can be added by selecting ‘New’ within the JobBoard menu in the Admin dashboard of WordPress" font_container="tag:p|font_size:13px|text_align:left|line_height:32px" use_theme_fonts="yes" custom_font_weight="fw-500" letter_spacing="0.05em" css=".vc_custom_1489979693101{padding-right: 8px !important;padding-left: 8px !important;}"][/vc_column][vc_column width="1/2" css=".vc_custom_1489979120248{padding-top: 0px !important;}"][vc_custom_heading text="Employers Add new job" font_container="tag:h3|font_size:18px|text_align:center|line_height:26px" use_theme_fonts="yes" custom_font_weight="fw-700" letter_spacing="0.05em" el_class="text-upper" css=".vc_custom_1489979463670{margin-bottom: 20px !important;}"][vc_single_image image="990" img_size="full" alignment="center" css_animation="fadeInRight" css=".vc_custom_1489979686566{margin-bottom: 22px !important;}"][vc_custom_heading text="Employers can add new jobs in their profile dashboard under ‘Post New’. Providing the employer has credits available then they can add their jobs." font_container="tag:p|font_size:13px|text_align:left|line_height:32px" use_theme_fonts="yes" custom_font_weight="fw-500" letter_spacing="0.05em" css=".vc_custom_1489979697195{padding-right: 8px !important;padding-left: 8px !important;}"][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row][vc_column el_class="rm-padding-sm" css=".vc_custom_1489980108649{padding-right: 40px !important;padding-left: 40px !important;}"][vc_empty_space height="104px"][vc_row_inner content_placement="middle"][vc_column_inner width="1/2" css=".vc_custom_1489980059941{padding-top: 0px !important;}"][vc_single_image image="997" img_size="full" alignment="center" css_animation="fadeInLeft" css=".vc_custom_1489980034287{margin-bottom: 22px !important;}"][/vc_column_inner][vc_column_inner width="1/2" css=".vc_custom_1489980063853{padding-top: 0px !important;}"][vc_custom_heading text="Creating a job is very simple with either method. Fill out each field in the post new job page, add the featured image, its tags and category and there you have it! Job posted." font_container="tag:div|font_size:16px|text_align:left|line_height:32px" use_theme_fonts="yes" letter_spacing="0.05em" css=".vc_custom_1489980007286{padding-right: 8px !important;padding-left: 8px !important;}"][/vc_column_inner][/vc_row_inner][vc_empty_space height="35px"][vc_separator color="custom" el_width="50" accent_color="#d8d8d8"][vc_empty_space height="70px"][vc_row_inner content_placement="middle"][vc_column_inner el_class="rm-padding-sm" width="1/2" css=".vc_custom_1489980688895{padding-right: 30px !important;}"][cms_fancybox_single title_item="Job Locations" icon_custom="zmdi zmdi-alert-polygon" box_align="content-right" description_item="You can manually select the job location within the GeoLocation section of adding a new job, or you can select pre-defined locations from the Location section. You’ll need to enter these locations from within the Locations menu of JobBoard in the WordPress admin dashboard." cms_template="cms_fancybox_single--layout4.php"][vc_empty_space][/vc_column_inner][vc_column_inner el_class="rm-padding-sm" width="1/2" css=".vc_custom_1489980696169{padding-left: 30px !important;}"][vc_single_image image="1000" img_size="full" alignment="center" css_animation="fadeInRight" css=".vc_custom_1489980381305{margin-bottom: 22px !important;}"][vc_empty_space][/vc_column_inner][/vc_row_inner][vc_empty_space height="60px"][vc_row_inner content_placement="middle"][vc_column_inner el_class="rm-padding-sm" width="1/2" css=".vc_custom_1489980668664{padding-right: 30px !important;}"][vc_single_image image="1001" img_size="full" alignment="center" css_animation="fadeInLeft" css=".vc_custom_1489982698606{margin-bottom: 22px !important;}"][vc_empty_space height="35px"][/vc_column_inner][vc_column_inner el_class="rm-padding-sm" width="1/2" css=".vc_custom_1489980660938{padding-left: 30px !important;}"][cms_fancybox_single title_item="Employer Packages" icon_custom="zmdi zmdi-alert-polygon" description_item="Earn monehy from your recruitment site! item.title: Jeremy S
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded: I don't know what else to say. Recruitment Agency Theme should be nominated for service of the year. I will let my friends know about this, they could really make use of Recruitment Agency Theme!

item.title: Dodi C
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded: I just can't get enough of Recruitment Agency Theme. I want to get a T-Shirt with Recruitment Agency Theme on it so I can show it off to everyone.

item.title: Paul W
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded: The very best. Great job, I will definitely be ordering again! I have gotten at least 50 times the value from Recruitment Agency Theme. It's just amazing.

item.content:encoded: Recruitment Agency Theme was the best investment I ever made. Best. Product. Ever! We were treated like royalty.
